attributes.action: Hold a second EU referendum because voters were mislead by Vote Leave and UKIP.
attributes.additional_details:
There is nothing at law to prevent a second referendum being held. The first one is not legally binding on Parliament.

The full petition wording is: -

“We ask the House of Commons and the House of Lords to legislate for a second EU referendum because voters were misinformed by the leave campaigners and in particular Vote Leave and UKIP and were misled concerning the consequences of a decision to leave the EU. The referendum needs to be held before the Article 50 notice is given.”
attributes.background: Now the results have been published and the leave supporters’ campaigns are revealed for what they are, which is to the most part very misleading to say the least, I ask you to legislate for a second referendum.
